channel.title: Startup Sequence
channel.itunes:subtitle: Demystifying tech decision-making! Two developers and a human being discuss the difficult world of technology, business, and building software that matters.
channel.itunes:summary: Demystifying tech decision-making! Two developers and a human being discuss the difficult world of technology, business, and building software that matters.
channel.description: Demystifying tech decision-making! Two developers and a human being discuss the difficult world of technology, business, and building software that matters.
channel.itunes:author: Micah Redding, Ann Howard

item.title: Ep 3: Why Open Source?
item.itunes:subtitle: Is open source dangerous? Insecure? Unsafe? Or is it the best platform to build your next product on? What does 'open source' even mean? Why do software developers love it so much? Learn all this and more, on our newest episode!
item.itunes:summary: Is open source dangerous? Insecure? Unsafe? Or is it the best platform to build your next product on? What does 'open source' even mean? Why do software developers love it so much? Learn all this and more, on our newest episode!
item.description: Is open source dangerous? Insecure? Unsafe? Or is it the best platform to build your next product on? What does 'open source' even mean? Why do software developers love it so much? Learn all this and more, on our newest episode!
item.content:encoded: Is open source dangerous? Insecure? Unsafe? Or is it the best platform to build your next product on? What does 'open source' even mean? Why do software developers love it so much? Learn all this and more, on our newest episode! Read our detailed notes here.
item.itunes:author: Micah Redding, Ann Howard

item.title: Ep 2: Programming as Gardening
item.itunes:subtitle: You're about to embark on a massive software project. What are you getting into? Are you building the pyramids or the botanical gardens? Is this a build-it-and-walk-away situation, or an ongoing endeavor requiring loving care and upkeep? Know what you’re getting into, and learn how to think about the significance of your role in the project.

item.itunes:author: Micah Redding, Ann Howard

item.title: Ep 1: Platforms vs Custom Development
item.itunes:subtitle: You've got deadlines, budget constraints, and incredible ambitions. Do you build your software on a platform that's already out there? Or do you develop everything from scratch? In this episode, we provide a framework to help you make your decision.
item.itunes:summary: You've got deadlines, budget constraints, and incredible ambitions. Do you build your software on a platform that's already out there? Or do you develop everything from scratch? In this episode, we provide a framework to help you make your decision.
item.description: You've got deadlines, budget constraints, and incredible ambitions. Do you build your software on a platform that's already out there? Or do you develop everything from scratch? In this episode, we provide a framework to help you make your decision.
item.content:encoded: You've got deadlines, budget constraints, and incredible ambitions. Do you build your software on a platform that's already out there? Or do you develop everything from scratch? In this episode, we provide a framework to help you visualize your decision, as well as a list of questions to consider as you go through the process. Read our detailed notes here.
item.itunes:author: Micah Redding, Ann Howard
